original: chos dang ldan pa'i chos kyis rnyed pa zhes bya ba dang / yon dbul bar byed pa ni tshe phyi ma la 'gro @21b ba gong mar 'gyur ba dang / skal ba bzang por 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa bde bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i chos kyis rnyed pa zhes bya ba dang / yon dbul bar byed pa ni tshe phyi ma la 'gro @21b ba gong mar 'gyur ba dang / skal ba bzang por 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa bde bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: to good fortune, to the ripening of happiness,🔽and to the attainment of the higher realms.

original: mtho ris 'grub par byed par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba dang / dge slong ngas khyed la skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi 'gro ba bdun dang / len pa med par mya ngan las 'das ba bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mtho ris 'grub par byed par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba dang / dge slong ngas khyed la skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi 'gro ba bdun dang / len pa med par mya ngan las 'das ba bshad par bya'o //
translated: Monks, I will explain to you the seven destinations of holy beings and the transcendence of suffering without grasping.

original: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi 'gro ba bdun gang zhe na /🔽dge slong dag 'di la dge slong ni 'di ltar bdag ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi 'gro ba bdun gang zhe na / dge slong dag 'di la dge slong ni 'di ltar bdag ma byung yang rung /

analyzed: bdag gi ma byung yang rung / bdag mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Whether I have come into existence or not,🔽whether I will come into existence or not,🔽I will not come into existence.

original: bdag gi mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: My not coming into existence will come into existence.”

original: de ltar na gang yod pa dang / gang byung ba de spang ngo snyam du btang snyoms thob la /
analyzed: de ltar na gang yod pa dang / gang byung ba de spang ngo snyam du btang snyoms thob la /
translated: Thus, having attained equanimity, thinking, “What exists and what has come into existence should be abandoned,”

original: de la chags par mi byed cing /
analyzed: de la chags par mi byed cing /

original: de'i 'og tu zhi ba'i go 'phang gong ma la shes rab kyis so sor rtog par byed do zhes bya ba dang / yod pa la yang yod pa nyid dang / med pa la yang med pa nyid dang / bla ma dang bcas pa la yang bla ma dang bcas pa nyid dang /

original: bla na med pa la yang bla na med pa nyid du shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / legs par mthong ba dang / legs par rig pa dang / legs par yid la byas pa dang / legs par brtan pa dang / legs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba dang /

translated: They are well seen, well known, well contemplated, well stabilized, and well realized.

original: 'dun pa skyed par byed /🔽rtsol bar byed /
analyzed: 'dun pa skyed par byed / rtsol bar byed /
translated: They generate interest.🔽They make effort.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: They apply diligence.🔽They fully focus the mind.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed /🔽rab tu 'jog par byed do zhes bya ba dang / 'dus pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed / rab tu 'jog par byed do zhes bya ba dang / 'dus pa dang ldan pa /
translated: They fully stabilize the mind.🔽They are endowed with assemblies.

original: tshogs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshogs dang ldan pa /
translated: They are endowed with gatherings.

original: tshogs kyi slob dpon skye bo mong pos zhi ba'i rang bzhin du kun tu shes pa /
analyzed: tshogs kyi slob dpon skye bo mong pos zhi ba'i rang bzhin du kun tu shes pa /
translated: They are the teachers of assemblies, and they are known by many people to have a peaceful nature.🔽They are led by great assemblies.

original: tshogs chen pos mdun gyis bdar ba zhes bya ba dang / dmag ldan chos 'di ni zab pa /
analyzed: tshogs chen pos mdun gyis bdar ba zhes bya ba dang / dmag ldan chos 'di ni zab pa /
translated: This Dharma is profound,

original: zab par snang ba /
analyzed: zab par snang ba /
translated: it appears profound,

original: mthong bar dka' ba /
analyzed: mthong bar dka' ba /
translated: it is difficult to see,

original: khong du chud par dka' ba /
analyzed: khong du chud par dka' ba /
translated: it is difficult to understand,

original: brtag mi nus pa /
analyzed: brtag mi nus pa /
translated: it cannot be examined,

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa /
translated: it is not the domain of sophistry,

original: zhib mos brtags pa'i mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas phan yon bcu gzigs nas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: zhib mos brtags pa'i mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas phan yon bcu gzigs nas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mdzad do //
translated: The wise who examine it in detail and the learned who understand it in depth should know that the Tathāgata established the bases of training for the disciples after seeing ten benefits in the training.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: @22a * // dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun legs par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun bde bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon par ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon par dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: @22a * // dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun legs par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun bde bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon par ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon par dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to gather the saṅgha, in order to make the saṅgha harmonious, in order to make the saṅgha happy, in order to inspire confidence in those without it, in order to increase the faith of those with confidence,

original: gang zag gnod mi bkur ba rnams tshar bcad pa'i phyir dang / ngo tsha shes pa rnams bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi zag pa rnams bsdam pa'i phyir dang / tshe rabs phyi ma'i zag pa rnams bzlog pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: gang zag gnod mi bkur ba rnams tshar bcad pa'i phyir dang / ngo tsha shes pa rnams bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi zag pa rnams bsdam pa'i phyir dang / tshe rabs phyi ma'i zag pa rnams bzlog pa'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to destroy those who harm and do not respect people, in order to make those who have a sense of shame live happily, in order to restrain the defilements of this life, in order to avert the defilements of future lives,

original: tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir ste nga'i tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / skye bo mang po la phan pa dang /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir ste nga'i tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / skye bo mang po la phan pa dang /
translated: in order to uphold pure conduct, in order to make pure conduct last long, in order to make my practice of pure conduct last long, in order to benefit many beings,🔽in order to make it flourish, and in order to teach it well to gods and humans.

original: rgyas pa dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi bar dag la yang dag par legs par rab tu bstan pa'o zhes bya ba dang / dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa sdug bsngal gang yin pa de 'gags pa dang / de nye bar zhi ba dang /
analyzed: rgyas pa dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi bar dag la yang dag par legs par rab tu bstan pa'o zhes bya ba dang / dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa sdug bsngal gang yin pa de 'gags pa dang / de nye bar zhi ba dang /
translated: And, Monks, for an arhat who has exhausted defilements, that suffering ceases, that suffering is pacified,🔽that suffering is brahma.

original: de bsil bar gyur pa dang / de nub pa zhes bya ba dang / bram ze de som nyi med cing 'gyod pa chad pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bsil bar gyur pa dang / de nub pa zhes bya ba dang / bram ze de som nyi med cing 'gyod pa chad pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la sred pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba dang /
translated: and that brahmin will be free of doubt and regret, free of craving for emergence and destruction, and his attachment will not increase.

original: dge slong dag mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sgoms shig dge slong dag mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa dang / bgrod par byas /
analyzed: dge slong dag mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sgoms shig dge slong dag mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa dang / bgrod par byas /
translated: Monks, cultivate the perception of impermanence. Monks, if you attend to the perception of impermanence, develop it, cultivate it, increase it, make it a vehicle,

original: rten du byas /
analyzed: rten du byas /
translated: make it a basis,

original: nan tan du byas shing shin tu rdzogs par byas la legs par brtsams pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing /
analyzed: nan tan du byas shing shin tu rdzogs par byas la legs par brtsams pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing /
translated: make it a support, make it a foundation, make it a reliance, and make it complete, then you will completely destroy all attachment to desire,

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig ba thams cad yang dag par 'joms te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig ba thams cad yang dag par 'joms te /
translated: all attachment to form, all attachment to the formless, all agitation, all pride, and all ignorance.

original: dper na khyim bdag zhing pa dbyar 'das nas ston gyi dus kyi tshe gshol chen pos zhing rnams rmed cing rmed pa na ram pa'i rtsa rgyus thams cad gcod par byed /
analyzed: dper na khyim bdag zhing pa dbyar 'das nas ston gyi dus kyi tshe gshol chen pos zhing rnams rmed cing rmed pa na ram pa'i rtsa rgyus thams cad gcod par byed /
translated: For example, a farmer householder, after the summer is over, in the autumn, when he is plowing the fields with a great plow, cuts all the grass and weeds,🔽cuts them completely,

original: kun tu gcod par byed /🔽mngon du gcod par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: kun tu gcod par byed / mngon du gcod par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: cuts them out.

original: dge slong dag mi rtag @22b pa'i 'du shes kun tu bsten cing snga ma bzhin du nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'i bar du yang dag par 'joms so //
analyzed: dge slong dag mi rtag @22b pa'i 'du shes kun tu bsten cing snga ma bzhin du nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'i bar du yang dag par 'joms so //
translated: In the same way, monks, the perception of impermanence, when it is attended to, as before, up to it completely conquers pride and ignorance.

original: dge slon dag dper na mi rtsva bal ba dza brnga ba zhig gis rtsva bal ba dza chung zhing nyung la mi mang ba shas shig mchog ma nas bzung ste /🔽sprug cing bar bur thams cad sel bar byed pa de ba zhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun tu bsten cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge slon dag dper na mi rtsva bal ba dza brnga ba zhig gis rtsva bal ba dza chung zhing nyung la mi mang ba shas shig mchog ma nas bzung ste / sprug cing bar bur thams cad sel bar byed pa de ba zhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun tu bsten cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: For example, monks, a man who is threshing a small amount of barely, a small amount of grass, a small amount of weeds, having taken hold of the top of the grass,

original: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'i bar du yang dag bar 'joms so //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'i bar du yang dag bar 'joms so //
translated: shakes it, and removes all the chaff. In the same way, monks, the perception of impermanence, when it is attended to, as before, up to it completely conquers pride and ignorance.

original: dper na shing thog aa mra'i dog pa la aa mra gang ci yod pa de thams cad ni rtsa rgyus dang ldan pa /🔽rtsa rgyus la /🔽brtan pa / rtsa rgyus dang 'brel pa /
analyzed: dper na shing thog aa mra'i dog pa la aa mra gang ci yod pa de thams cad ni rtsa rgyus dang ldan pa / rtsa rgyus la / brtan pa / rtsa rgyus dang 'brel pa /
translated: For example, whatever fruits there are on a mango tree are all connected to the trunk,🔽are based on the trunk,🔽are supported by the trunk,

original: rtsa rgyus su 'du ba /
analyzed: rtsa rgyus su 'du ba /
translated: are included in the trunk,🔽and are not separate from the trunk.

original: rtsa rgyus dang ma bral ba dag yin zhing de dag las 'byung ba yin pa de pa zhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun tu bsten cing ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsa rgyus dang ma bral ba dag yin zhing de dag las 'byung ba yin pa de pa zhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun tu bsten cing ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, the perception of impermanence is to be cultivated, as before.

original: dper na gtsang khang phyur bu'i phyam dgu po gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni spyi rten la gnas /
analyzed: dper na gtsang khang phyur bu'i phyam dgu po gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni spyi rten la gnas /
translated: For example, whatever there is of the nine layers of the temple, all of that is based on the foundation,

original: spyi rten la brten /
analyzed: spyi rten la brten /
translated: is supported by the foundation,

original: spyi rten la rag las /
analyzed: spyi rten la rag las /
translated: is dependent on the foundation,🔽is included in the foundation,🔽and is not separate from the foundation.

analyzed: spyi rten la gzhol bas spyi rten ni de rnams kyi mchog yin par bstan te /
translated: The foundation is taught to be the best of them,

original: 'di lta ste kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it holds everything together.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, the perception of impermanence is to be cultivated, as before.

original: dper na srog chags dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi rjes gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad glang po che'i rjes su 'dus shing khongs su chud pas glang po che'i rjes ni de rnams kyi mchog tu bstan te /🔽'di lta ste /

translated: Thus, the elephant’s footprint is taught as the foremost of them.

original: che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the greatest.

analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, the perception of impermanence is the foremost of the perceptions.

analyzed: dper na 'dzam bu'i gling du 'bab chu gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni rgya mtshor gzhol ba /
translated: For example, whatever rivers there are that flow into Jambudvīpa all flow into the ocean.

original: rgya mtsho 'bab pa yin /🔽rgya mtshor bab pa yin pas rgya mtsho ni de rnams kyi mchog yin par bstan te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho 'bab pa yin / rgya mtshor bab pa yin pas rgya mtsho ni de rnams kyi mchog yin par bstan te /
translated: They flow to the ocean.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They have flowed into the ocean. Thus, the ocean is taught as the foremost of them.

original: kun tu sdud pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: kun tu sdud pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it is the greatest.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, the perception of impermanence is the foremost of the perceptions.

analyzed: dper na gnam las nyi ma shar ba ni gnam la yogs pa'i mun pa thams cad 'od kyi zil gyis mnan nas lham me lhan ne lhang nge'o //
translated: For example, when the sun rises in the sky, it outshines all the darkness covering the sky and shines, glows, and radiates.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no //🔽dper na 'khor los sgyur pa'i @23a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyang snga ma bzhin no // dper na 'khor los sgyur pa'i @23a * //
translated: In the same way, the perception of impermanence is as stated above.

analyzed: rgyal po ni khams kyi rgyal po gang ji snyed pa de rnams kyi mchog yin te /
translated: For example, a universal monarch is the supreme one among all the kings of the realm.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is because

original: dbang byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dbang byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: he has power over them.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun tu bstan cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa dang / bgrod par byas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kun tu bstan cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa dang / bgrod par byas /
translated: In the same way, the perception of impermanence, when taught, cultivated, practiced,

original: rten du byas /
analyzed: rten du byas /
translated: made a basis,🔽made a support,

original: nan tan du byas shing shin tu rdzogs par byas la /
analyzed: nan tan du byas shing shin tu rdzogs par byas la /
translated: and made complete,

original: legs par brtsams pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing /
analyzed: legs par brtsams pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing /
translated: destroys all attachment to desire.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms so //
translated: It completely destroys all attachment to form, all attachment to the formless, all agitation, all pride, and all ignorance.🔽The summary:🔽The farmer, the merchant, the seal,

original: sdom ni / zhing pa dang ni gres ma brda /
analyzed: sdom ni / zhing pa dang ni gres ma brda /
translated: the container, the common support,🔽the echo, the waterfall, the sun,

analyzed: dog pa dang ni spyi rten dang // rjes dang 'bab chu nyi ma dang // brgyad pa rgyal po yin par 'dod //
translated: and the king are considered the eighth.🔽And:

translated: Venerable ones, when the Dharma preacher monk gives a Dharma talk, he should do so with these twenty aspects:

original: dus su dang / gus pa dang / go rims dang / 'tshams sbyar ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / dga' bar bya ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / mgu bar bya ba dang / spro ba skyed pa dang / mi smad pa dang /
analyzed: dus su dang / gus pa dang / go rims dang / 'tshams sbyar ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / dga' bar bya ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / mgu bar bya ba dang / spro ba skyed pa dang / mi smad pa dang /
translated: timely, respectfully, in sequence, with a connection, in a way that is appropriate, delightful, desirable, pleasing, inspiring, and without contempt.

original: rigs pa dang / 'brel pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba bzhin dang / byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la mi rten pa dang /
analyzed: rigs pa dang / 'brel pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba bzhin dang / byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la mi rten pa dang /
translated: It is to be reasonable, connected, unmixed, in accord with the Dharma, in accord with the assembly, with a loving mind, with a helpful mind, with a mind of compassion, not relying on gain, honor, or fame,

original: gtam de dag brjod pa na bdag la bstod par mi bya zhing gzhan la smad par mi bya la gtam yang bya ba ste /
analyzed: gtam de dag brjod pa na bdag la bstod par mi bya zhing gzhan la smad par mi bya la gtam yang bya ba ste /
